intro: Crusea hispida, commonly known as the rough crusea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically red or orange in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
